items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Cash Markets Ease into Weekend After Historic Natural Gas Demand Spike
items.summary: With production roaring back and temperatures moderating in at least some regions, physical natural gas prices continued to ease off the eye-watering highs reached at the height of Winter Storm Fern.

items.title: Futures Settle: March Natural Gas Posts 20% Weekly Gain on Tight Supply, Stubborn Cold
items.summary: Shrinking inventories, lingering production freeze-offs and hints of a possible mid-February cold shot fueled impressive gains for natural gas futures on Friday.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Losses Ripple Through Natural Gas Cash Prices
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices were moving lower at midday Friday, with declines across major hubs despite cold-driven demand and still-intact production freeze-off risks.

items.title: Iroquois, Algonquin Lead Natural Gas Forwards Higher Amid Frigid Weather
items.summary: The forward curve climbed higher over the past week, again driven by huge shifts in the Northeast, where spot prices climbed well above $100/MMBtu as the region grappled with extreme winter weather like most of the country.

items.title: ExxonMobil Sees First Golden Pass Cargo in Early March, Potential Mozambique FID by Year-End
items.summary: ExxonMobil is doubling down on natural gas, with LNG now grouped with the Permian Basin and Guyana as drivers of the company’s upstream future.

items.title: U.S., Iranian Tensions Escalate, Threatening Global Crude, Natural Gas Markets
items.summary: Golden Pass LNG in Texas has begun the process to start liquefaction operations.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Prompt Month Explodes Higher
items.summary: March natural gas futures vaulted back above the $4/MMBtu level into midday Friday as sustained cold risks into mid-February eclipsed a rapid rebound in Lower 48 production.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Lofty South Central Storage Draw Activity Bucks Up Permian Natural Gas Prices – Briefly
items.summary: A whopping late January withdrawal of natural gas from storage in the South Central cut into excess supply, amplifying the effects of a widespread and bitter cold front that sent heating demand soaring and Permian Basin production into the doldrums.

items.title: Natural Gas Outlook Brightens as Oilfield Services Giants Forecast 2027 Recovery
items.summary: Top oilfield services (OFS) executives are casting 2026 as a transition year marked by subdued North America activity, but they expect the market to rebalance by 2027.

items.title: Why Venezuela’s Oil Comeback Is Proving Harder Than Trump Expected
items.summary: After U.S. forces snatched Nicolas Maduro in a daring night raid earlier this month, President Donald Trump began pressing oil companies to invest in Venezuela’s heavily corroded petroleum industry. The U.S. president eagerly urged drillers to invest

items.title: EU Weighs Scrapping Russia Oil Price Cap for Harder Sanctions
items.summary: The European Union is quietly preparing to take a much bigger swing at Russia’s oil trade. And this time, Brussels is aiming less at price optics and more at enforcement reality. The EU is reportedly weighing whether to scrap its Russian oil price ca

items.title: US Oil Drilling Continues to Flounder
items.summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States rose by 2 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US  to 546 this week, down 36 from this same time last

items.title: OPEC+ Poised to Maintain Oil Output in March as Brent Breaks $70
items.summary: The OPEC+ group is expected to maintain its oil production policy unchanged this weekend and affirm a pause in output hikes in March even as Brent Crude prices hit $70 per barrel this week for the first time in five months, delegates from the allianc

items.title: Trump's Whiplash Iran Rhetoric Keeps Oil Bulls in Control
items.summary: Markets looked past rising supply as shifting U.S. rhetoric on Iran and ongoing weather-related disruptions kept risk premiums elevated. Friday, January 30, 2026 Trump’s erratic rhetoric has been greatly supportive of oil prices this week, first prom

items.title: Glut To Trump Geopolitics to Keep Oil Price around $60 This Year
items.summary: The global oversupply is set to override geopolitical flare-ups this year, keeping oil prices close to the $60 per barrel mark, the monthly Reuters poll showed on Friday. Brent Crude prices are expected to average $62.02 per barrel in 2026, according
